title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point

· Both bacteria and fungi recycle nutrients by breaking down organic matter.

· Both bacteria and fungi break down dead and decaying matter as their primary energy source.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

· Both bacteria and fungi recycle nutrients by breaking down organic matter.

· Both bacteria and fungi break down dead and decaying matter as their primary energy source.

Student response earns one of the following points.

· Both bacteria and fungi recycle nutrients by breaking down organic matter.

· Both bacteria and fungi break down dead and decaying matter as their primary energy source.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Describe that the water only treatment is a control that allows any change in the experimental groups to be attributed to the presence or absence of bacteria or fungi.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

Describe that the water only treatment is a control that allows any change in the experimental groups to be attributed to the presence or absence of bacteria or fungi.

Student response earns one of the following points.

Describe that the water only treatment is a control that allows any change in the experimental groups to be attributed to the presence or absence of bacteria or fungi.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Prediction (1 point)

The Group 1 treatment will result in the smallest amount of accessible nutrients in the soil at the end of the experiment.
Justification (1 point)

Keystone species have a disproportionate impact on the ecosystem relative to their abundance.
